page.title: 11HOUSING
page.content: THE HOUSES OF BILLINGHAY ARE MAINLY BRICK. THE ROOFS ARE EITHER TILED OR SLATED. MOST OF THE HOUSES ARE ABOUT 3OO YEARS OLD. ST MICHAELS CLOSE AND FITZWILLIAM PLACE ARE ONLY ABOUT TEN YEARS OLD. THERE ARE NO NEW HOUSING ESTATES IN BILLINGHAY BUT OPPOSITE THE LAFFORD - BILLINGHAY'S SECONDARY MODERN - THERE ARE ABOUT SIX NEW HOUSES BEING BUILT. THERE ARE SOME FLATS ABOVE THE SHOPS BUT THERE ARE NO BLOCKS OF FLATS. THERE ARE LOTS OF DETACHED HOUSES, A FEW SEMI-DETACHED HOUSES AND A ROW OF TERRACED HOUSES DOWN THE HIGH STREET. THERE ARE ALSO SOME TERRACED HOUSES IN CHURCH STREET, NEAR THE PRIMARY SCHOOL.
